artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
inscription: LL margin, in red, Japanese inscription; URC, in cartouche, Japanese inscription; Japanese inscription center of upper margin
life_date: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi, Japanese, 1839–1892; Sasaki Toyokichi, Publisher; Wada Yūjirō, Carver, Japanese, 1857–1905
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and colors on paper
portfolio: New Forms of Thirty-Six Ghosts (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
text: Second variation of first edition. The first variation has also blue in the print title cartouche. The second edition was produced by Daikokuya Heikichi in 1902.
title: Kiyomori Sees Hundreds of Skulls at Fukuhara
